survey.title: Design maturity
survey.description: This survey measures the maturity of design. Responses will be used to track progress and identify areas for improvement.

questions.question_text: Do leaders support and prioritise design in decision-making?
Are design principles included when new policies or services are developed?
Do teams work together on whole services, instead of just individual products?
Do we regularly map out how different services connect to create a better experience for users?
Do we design services that are easy to use, accessible, and inclusive for all users?
Are accessibility and inclusion built into every stage of service development, rather than an afterthought?
Do we have a clear view of how all services fit together and what users experience?
Do we use service mapping to identify duplication and reduce unnecessary complexity?
Do we use data, research, and real feedback to shape and improve services?
Are decisions about services based on evidence, rather than assumptions or personal opinions?
Do we regularly update and improve services based on feedback and data?
Do teams have the time and support they need to iterate and improve services, rather than just delivering new things?

themes.theme_name: Using the right tools and standards

questions.question_text: Do we follow government standards, patterns, and best practices?
Is there a shared understanding of what good design looks like across different teams?
Do we collaborate with designers in other departments to share and learn?
Are we contributing to government-wide standards and aligning with best practices?
Are we developing, supporting, and retaining designers at all levels?
Do we have a strong pipeline of new designers, including junior roles and apprentices?
Do we know if our services are working well and delivering real value?
Do we have clear, meaningful service metrics that help teams make better decisions?

rating_scale.label: Not happening – We don't do this yet.
Rarely – We do this sometimes, but not consistently.
Making progress – We do this in some areas, but it needs to improve.
Mostly there – We do this well, but there's still room for improvement.
Fully embedded – This is part of how we work every day.

scoring_method.question_score: Each question is rated from 1-5, with higher scores indicating greater service maturity.
scoring_method.theme_score: Each theme's score is the average of its questions' scores.
scoring_method.overall_score: The overall maturity score is the average of all theme scores.
scoring_method.tracking: Scores can be tracked over time to measure improvements.
